SmProcessing

Class FFourierTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • SmProcessing.FFourierTransform

  • public class FFourierTransform
extends java.lang.Object
    This class calculates the FFT of an array using the Apache Commons Math package and returns the result as magnitudes (square root of the squares of the real and imaginary parts). It first pads the array to the next closest power-of-2 length before calculating the FFT.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FFourierTransform()
      Constructor just initializes variables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[] calculateFFT(double[] array)
      Performs the FFT calculations by padding the input array AT THE END to the closest power of 2 gt or eq to the current length, calling the FFT transform method, extracting only the first half of the complex array returned and converting these values to magnitudes.
      org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] calculateFFTComplex(double[] array)
      Performs the FFT calculations by padding the input array AT THE END to the closest power of 2 gt or eq to the current length, calling the FFT transform method, and returning the complex array.
      org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] calculateFFTComplexFront(double[] array)
      Performs the FFT calculations by padding the input array AT THE START to the closest power of 2 gt or eq to the current length, calling the FFT transform method, and returning the complex array.
      int findPower2Length(int length)
      finds the nearest power of 2 that is greater than or equal to the input value
      int getPowerLength()
      Getter for the calculated power of 2 length
      double[] inverseFFTComplex(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] transfreq)
      Calculates the inverse FFT on an input complex array (first padding if needed with complex zeros at the END of the array) and returns an array of doubles containing only the real component of the iFFT result.
      void normalizeMags(double[] mags, int original_length)
      Normalizes the magnitudes after the FFT by dividing each magnitude by the number of elements in the original array input to the FFT (not the length of the magnitude array).
      org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] shiftBack(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] inarray)
      inverse of shiftforward, returning the zero frequency to the start of the array
      org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] shiftForward(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] inarray)
      shifts the zero frequency to the center of the array

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FFourierTransform

        public FFourierTransform()
        Constructor just initializes variables.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateFFT

        public double[] calculateFFT(double[] array)
        Performs the FFT calculations by padding the input array AT THE END to the closest power of 2 gt or eq to the current length, calling the FFT transform method, extracting only the first half of the complex array returned and converting these values to magnitudes.
        Parameters:
        array - input array for calculating the transform
        Returns:
        the magnitudes of the transformed array

      • normalizeMags

        public void normalizeMags(double[] mags,
                          int original_length)
        Normalizes the magnitudes after the FFT by dividing each magnitude by the number of elements in the original array input to the FFT (not the length of the magnitude array). The input magnitude array is modified.
        Parameters:
        mags - magnitudes of the transformed array (real values, not complex)
        original_length - length of the real array input to calculateFFT

      • calculateFFTComplex

        public org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] calculateFFTComplex(double[] array)
        Performs the FFT calculations by padding the input array AT THE END to the closest power of 2 gt or eq to the current length, calling the FFT transform method, and returning the complex array.
        Parameters:
        array - input array for calculating the transform
        Returns:
        the transformed array

      • calculateFFTComplexFront

        public org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] calculateFFTComplexFront(double[] array)
        Performs the FFT calculations by padding the input array AT THE START to the closest power of 2 gt or eq to the current length, calling the FFT transform method, and returning the complex array.
        Parameters:
        array - input array for calculating the transform
        Returns:
        the transformed array

      • inverseFFTComplex

        public double[] inverseFFTComplex(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] transfreq)
        Calculates the inverse FFT on an input complex array (first padding if needed with complex zeros at the END of the array) and returns an array of doubles containing only the real component of the iFFT result.
        Parameters:
        transfreq - array of complex frequency values
        Returns:
        an array containing the real components of the iFFT result

      • findPower2Length

        public int findPower2Length(int length)
        finds the nearest power of 2 that is greater than or equal to the input value
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the input array
        Returns:
        the nearest power of 2 length

      • shiftForward

        public org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] shiftForward(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] inarray)
        shifts the zero frequency to the center of the array
        Parameters:
        inarray - input complex array to shift
        Returns:
        shifted array

      • shiftBack

        public org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] shiftBack(org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex[] inarray)
        inverse of shiftforward, returning the zero frequency to the start of the array
        Parameters:
        inarray - shifted complex array to reset
        Returns:
        un-shifted array

      • getPowerLength

        public int getPowerLength()
        Getter for the calculated power of 2 length
        Returns:
        the power of 2 length
